conclusion: Predict which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid flows from sources A, B, and C as shown in the second image.
The liquid from A is yellow, from B is cyan, and from C is orange.
The yellow liquid flows down and encounters a baffle that directs it horizontally to the right.
Yellow liquid hits another baffle and is directed downwards towards the center of the image.
Yellow liquid flows horizontally to the left and then down into container D.
Cyan liquid flows down and encounters a similar series of baffles.
Cyan liquid is directed horizontally to the right, then downwards, and finally horizontally to the left before flowing into container D.
Orange liquid follows a path similar to the cyan liquid but is slightly offset to the right.
Orange liquid ends up flowing into container D after navigating the baffles.
In the third image, both the yellow and cyan liquids have indeed flowed into container D.
Orange liquid, although partially visible, appears to be following the same path and will also end up in container D.
All the liquid from sources A, B, and C will flow into container D.
Container E will not receive any liquid.
